tuv.seg: Tax relief on nursing home fees and for dependent relatives
Faoiseamh Cánach ar Tháillí Tithe Altranais agus ar son Gaolta
Income tax relief is available on fees paid for nursing homes
Tá fáil ar fhaoiseamh ó cháin ioncaim ar tháillí a íoctar as tithe altranais
There also are a number of other tax reliefs for carers and people with disabilities
Tá roinnt faoisimh eile chánach ann do chúramóirí agus do dhaoine atá faoi mhíchumas
Income tax relief is available on fees paid for nursing homes
Faoiseamh cánach ar tháillí tithe altranais
You claim tax relief for nursing home fees under the general scheme for tax relief on medical expenses
Éilíonn tú faoiseamh cánach ar tháillí teach altranais faoin scéim ghinearálta d’fhaoiseamh canach ar chostais leighis
Tax relief on nursing home fees applies at the highest rate of income tax that you pay
Cuirtear an faoiseamh cánach ar tháillí tithe altranais i bhfeidhm ar an ráta is airde de cháin ioncaim a íocann tú
If you are paying the charges for a nursing home you can claim the tax relief, whether you are in the nursing home yourself or you are paying for another person to be there
Má tá na muirir á n-íoc agat ar theach altranais, féadfaidh tú an faoiseamh cánach a éileamh, cibé acu má tá tú sa teach altranais tú féin nó má tá tú ag íoc as duine eile a bheith ann
Usually you claim the tax relief at the end of the year but in certain circumstances tax relief may be available in the current year through the PAYE system
De ghnáth, éilíonn tú an faoiseamh cánach ag deireadh na bliana cánach, ach faoi roinnt cúinsí, d’fhéadfadh an faoiseamh cánach a bheith ar fáil sa bhliain reatha tríd an gcóras ÍMAT
See Revenue’s information leaflet IT 6 Medical Expenses Relief
Féach bileog faisnéise na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim IT 6 Faoiseamh ar Chostais Liachta
For further information, including how to apply, see our document on taxation and medical expenses
Chun teacht ar a thuilleadh faisnéise, lena n-áirítear conas iarratas a dhéanamh, féach ár gcáipéis ar chánachas agus costais leighis
You can claim tax relief on the cost of employing a carer for yourself or for another family member
Féadfaidh tú faoiseamh cánach a éileamh ar an gcostas chun cúramóir a fhostú duit féin nó do dhuine muinteartha eile
If you are caring for a dependent relative you may qualify for the Dependent Relative Tax Credit
Má tá cúram á thabhairt agat do ghaol cleithiúnach, d’fhéadfá cáiliú don Chreidmheas Cánach do Ghaolta Cleithiúnacha
A deed of covenant is a legally binding agreement that is written down and agreed between two people stating that one agrees to pay money to the other without getting any benefit in return

Comhaontú atá ina cheanglas dlíthiúil is ea gníomhas cúnaint a ndéanann beirt daoine a scríobh síos agus a chomhaontú ina luaitear go gcomhaontaíonn duine amháin chun airgead a íoc leis an duine eile gan aon tairbhe a fháil mar thoradh air
Tax relief on a Deed of Covenant is available if it is made to a permanently incapacitated minor, permanently incapacitated adult, or person over 65 years of age
Tá fáil ar fhaoiseamh cánach ar Ghníomhas Cúnaint má dhéantar é le mionaoiseach atá ar éagumas buan, le duine fásta atá ar éagumas buan, nó le duine os cionn 65 bliain d’aois
There are also a number of other tax reliefs for people with disabilities
Anuas air sin, tá roinnt faoisimh chánacha eile ann do dhuine atá faoi mhíchumas
